snippet: The agreement to pay retired players who claim damage from concussions is an overdue step in the N.F.L.’s evolution.
abstract: Editorial contends National Football League's agreeing to pay $765 million to more than 4,500 retired players who claim long-term damages from concussions while playing is chilling prologue to the football season; warns settlement does little to resolve continuing threat to players from traumatic hits since NFL has not formally admitted culpability.
lead_paragraph: The agreement to pay retired players who claim damage from concussions is an overdue step in the N.F.L.’s evolution.
